body.p: President of the Confederate States. Member of the Democratic Party. Married to Sarah Knox Taylor briefly in 1835, and remarried Varina Banks Howell in 1845. Father of Samuel Emory Davis, Margaret Howell Davis Hayes, Jefferson Davis, Jr., Joseph Evan Davis, William Howell Davis, and Varina Anne Davis. Educated at St. Thomas College in Springfield, Kentucky; Jefferson College in Adams County, Mississippi; Wilkinson County Academy in Woodville, Mississippi; Transylvania University in Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky; and the United States Military Academy in West Point, New York. Serves in the U.S. Army in Missouri, Illinois, Iowa Territory, and Wisconsin Territory. Served as state Democratic presidential elector in 1844. Represented an At-large District of Mississippi in the United States House of Representatives from 1845 to 1846. Serves as a colonel in Mexico with the 1st Mississippi Regiment in 1846 and 1847. Served as a senator from Mississippi in the United States Senate from 1847 to 1851 and 1857 to 1861. Served as the Secretary of War of the United States from 1853 to 1857. Elected president of the Confederate State on February 9, 1861 and served until capture by Federal forces on May 10, 1865.
